hints.content: For fractions to be equivalent, they must represent the same area of the whole.
Let's use a visual model to see which fractions shade the same area of the whole as $\blueD{\dfrac{2}{4}}$.

![rectangle with 2 of 4 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 fourth. same sized rectangle below it, with 1 of 2 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 half](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c9b301115246e979221febdca75032a7b44522a5)

$\blueD{\dfrac{2}{4}} = \greenD{\dfrac{1}{2}}$

![rectangle with 1 of 4 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 fourth. same sized rectangle below it, with 2 of 6 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 sixth](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/de25b3d6e8b8141e161448f996bbfb78be9a548a)

$\blueD{\dfrac{2}{4}} \neq \maroonD{\dfrac{2}{6}}$

![rectangle with 2 of 4 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 fourth. same sized rectangle below it, with 4 of 8 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 eighth](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1ac6f3a25f883bb266efcf1f30671229a7427a1d)

$\blueD{\dfrac{2}{4}} = \purpleD{\dfrac{4}{8}}$

![rectangle with 2 of 4 equal parts shaded, with each part labeled 1 fourth. same sized rectangle below it, with 3 of 4 equal parts shaded, each labeled with 1 fourth](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/71afbb5d6d4b8a1268b0843dda71e84ec13788b3)

$\blueD{\dfrac{2}{4}} \neq \goldE{\dfrac{3}{4}}$

The following fractions are equivalent to $\blueD{\dfrac24}$:

- $\greenD{\dfrac{1}{2}}$
- $\purpleD{\dfrac{4}{8}}$

question.content:
**Which of the following fractions are equivalent to $\dfrac24$?**
